The following is a list of Nobel Prize winners whose work has had influence on, or is related to, the topics we have discussed in this book
Sulston for their discoveries concerning genetic regulation of organ development and programmed cell death (Physiology or Medicine
Nurse for their discoveries of key regulators of the cell cycle (Physiology or Medicine
Wieschaus for their discoveries concerning the genetic control of early embryonic development (Physiology or Medicine
Sharp for their independent discoveries of split genes (Physiology or Medicine
Temin for their discoveries concerning the interaction between tumour viruses and the genetic material of the cell (Physiology or Medicine
Anfinsen for his work on ribonuclease, especially concerning the connection between the amino acid sequence and the biologically active confirmation
Stein for their contribution to the understanding of the connection between chemical structure and catalytic activity of the active centre of the ribonuclease molecule (Chemistry
Luria for their discoveries concerning the replication mechanism and the genetic structure of viruses (Physiology or Medicine
Nirenberg for their interpretation of the genetic code and its function in protein synthesis
Wilkins for their discoveries concerning the molecular structure of nuclear acids and its significance for information transfer in living material (Physiology or Medicine
Todd for his work on nucleotides and nucleotide co-enzymes (Chemistry
